intro: Polygala senega, commonly known as the showy milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the central and eastern United States. It features slender, upright stems that are often hairy and can grow up to 2 feet tall. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Polygala senega is typically found in moist soils along streambanks and in open woodlands.
